intro: Pteracanthus gongshanensis, commonly known as the Gongshan pteracanthus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province, China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
